title: Adding argument for color palettes
body:
Hi, 

I was thinking that it could be nice to add an argument to plotting functions for what color palette to use in the graphs (using your rgb_vec_sports as standard if nothing else is specified)
If you think it's a good idea I can have a look at adding it!

Signe

title: Test_issue
body: Testa issues

title: Error messages in Windows (that won't mess up the code but may be fixed for aesthetic reasons)
body:
Running make_counts in Windows causes following error;
ITACT4KW is the name of my computer 
"Warning message:
In for (v in val) { :
  closing unused connection 3 (<-ITACT4KW.ad.liu.se:11297)"

Running make_anno in Windows will make data.table to run on 2 threads instead of the 1 demanded by user in function. 

Running map_reanno in Windows will throw out error like this;
"Warning messages:
1: In file.remove(fls_full[!fls %in% drs]) :
  cannot remove file 'C:/Users/sigsk47/Documents/PhD/R/Genomes/test/anno_mis0.fa', reason 'Permission denied'
2: In file.remove(fls_full[!fls %in% drs]) :
  cannot remove file 'C:/Users/sigsk47/Documents/PhD/R/Genomes/test/anno_mis1.fa', reason 'Permission denied'"

title: Error messages in Linux environment
body:
**map_reanno:** 
When running 2 or more mismatches, this error pops up. Not present in 1 or 0, where it runs smoothly

> |--- Found 5 bowtie file(s) with hits and 0 without.
>   |--- Import and reorganize Ensembl.outError in data.table::fread(files[k], header = FALSE, select = c(1, 8),  : 
>   Column number 8 (select[2]) is out of range [1,ncol=2]

title: simplify_reanno
body:
When user puts in hierarchy with a name not present in "original biotypes", this is set to "" in search terms (row 116 in code). This makes it so that everything that has not already been assigned something, becomes assigned that particular biotype. See pic for example
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63866910/96278059-5006b680-0fd5-11eb-9b90-83f727d41e99.png)

title: PAC_norm
body: The row names are lost when running the rlog function (row names in pac$norm$rlog). I cannot figure out how to change this since rlogTransformation is a DEseq2 function and has no options regarding this.

title: PAC_deseq - main_factor
body: Should default instead be the last factor provided in model? (since design = model)

title: add_reanno
body:
Windows environment

When running add_reanno without PAC merging, a file is created where mis0_bio contains all unique biotypes/searchterms (35 unique in this case). But when add_reanno is ran with PAC-merge, the mis0_bio only contains a few of the search terms (in my case only 3) and Anno$mis0 instead has all search terms. 
This would be ok, but when adding hierarchy with simplify_reanno, that functions searches for "mis0_bio" unless other is noted with target_column, so if one is not aware of this and leaves target_column=NULL, simplify_reanno will not work

title: merging PAC with TRUE/FALSE or as value
body:
In some functions (like PAC_summary), merging with PAC is a true/false vector, whilst in other functions (like add_reanno) you provide the PAC list you want to merge with as a value. 
Maybe decide on one way and keep it constant for all functions?

title: General fixes for code
body:
**Unified expressions throughout**
In PAc_summary, it's called "colors", but in most other plot functions it's called "colvec". Decide on one and use that through all functions for concerted names of similar vectors

**Plot y-axis**
Fun.y is deprecated. Use fun instead. Have fixed that in some graphs I've come across in my fork, but think this is global for all plots unfortuantely. Easily fixed though

**PAC_stackbar**
When using anno_target, the total amount of reads (called tot_cnts) are not updated per the anno-filtering, resulting in white blocks of NA in the final graph.

title: PAC_mapper does not accept ref
body:
Running PAC_mapper throws

`Error in file.exists(ref) : invalid 'file' argument`

when using Biostrings to read in ref.

`ref <- Biostrings::readDNAStringSet("C:/Users/sigsk47/Documents/PhD/R/Genomes/Drosophila_melanogaster/tRNA/tRNA.fa")`

Running with file location instead, as

`ref<-"C:/Users/sigsk47/Documents/PhD/R/Genomes/Drosophila_melanogaster/tRNA/tRNA.fa")`

starts the reanno flow, but soon throws error message; 

`map_tRNA <- PAC_mapper2(PAC_dn, ref=ref, mapper="reanno", threads=1, mismatches = 0, report_string = TRUE)

Reading reference from file ...

R internal mapping using the Rbowtie package was specified.
This package uses bowtie version bowtie.exeversion1.2.2.
If you need a newer version, please install Bowtie manually
outside R and then use option type='external'.


******************************************************
|--- Mismatch 0 started at 09:19:04
|--- Bowtie mapping:
   |---> reference...

 Error: '\U' used without hex digits in character string starting "'C:\U" `

Strangely, this does not happen in the normal reanno-flow. Adding double dash "\\" instead of "/" does not fix this error.

title: PAC_deseq
body:
Running latest version of main causes error with PAC_deseq
`
"Error: 'summary.DESeqResults' is not an exported object from 'namespace:DESeq2' `

Earliest working version I have saved and can try in S_branch works just fine, so the issue have been introduced in between those. May just be printing the summary in "cat(DESeq2::summary.DESeqResults(res_DESeq2))" that is a bug, but as it throws error it breaks the function.

title: Example Data
body: Need to rerun the "sample PCA" - "drosophila_sRNA_pac.Rdata" through everything again and update that file. RIght now it e.g has "Length" instead of "Size" in Anno

title: make_counts cannot reach make_trim internally on Windows
body:
make_counts fails in calling make_trim when trimming="seqpac" on windows with error message 

"Error in { : task 1 failed - "Input/Output
  no input files found
  dirPath: C:/BaseSpace/trimmade/Index11_S5_L001_R1_001.trim.fastq.gz
  pattern: character(0)" 

In this example, I ran the Supplementary code as follows;


```
input = "C:/Users/sigsk47/Desktop/seqpactest/ena_files/"
output = "C:/Users/sigsk47/Desktop/seqpactest/out/"
counts_seq  <- make_counts(input, threads=1, parse=parse, type="fastq",
                           trimming="seqpac", plot=TRUE, evidence=c(experiment=2, sample=1))
```

But, as you can see, the dirPath in the error message is not my input, but rather an old fastq file from last time I ran make_trim on a whole other dataset.
Running the make_trim on its own and then running make_counts with trimming=NULL works flawlessly.

```
input = "C:/Users/sigsk47/Desktop/seqpactest/out/"
counts_seq  <- make_counts(input, threads=1, parse=parse, type="fastq",
                           trimming=NULL, plot=TRUE, evidence=c(experiment=2, sample=1))
```

title: PAC_mapper in Windows
body:
Unsure if this is Windows related issue, but running PAC_mapper with mapper="reanno" says that " Error in do.call("rbind", strsplit(nams, "\\d_\\("))[, 2] : 
  subscript out of bounds " in PAC file with ~500 sequences from fly.

The error stems from row 209 ,"strnd_ref <- do.call("rbind", strsplit(nams, "\\d_\\("))[,2]"
Running the code with commenting the whole "if(sum(type_test1, type_test2) == 2 ){" and keeping the "else" part makes the code run fine. Didn't want to remove this part of the script as I was unsure of the reason for the if-statement.

title: Add option to merge lanes from sequencing
body: When downloading FASTQ-files from BaseSpace Downloader, files does not automatically merge together from lanes. We should add lane merge prior to counts in make_counts, to make the trimming and counts flow streamlined for some Windows users.

title: Add option to merge PAC files
body:
Giving the user the possibility to merge PAC files easily with a function may facilitate in making comparisons between different datasets e.g. 
Take into consideration that different pac objects have not been run trough the same evidence filter. Some type of filtering should either be done after merge, or be prompted to the user.

title: PAC_mapper
body:
PAC_mapper with mapper="reanno" throws error:
```
Error in do.call("rbind", strsplit(nams, "\\d_\\("))[, 2] : 
  subscript out of bounds
```

tried running a few parts of splt_x list at random but couldn't find any that was TRUE in "(sum(type_test1, type_test2) == 2)" to test the error in closer detail. 

PAC_mapper with mapper="vmatch" works. 


code ran:

```

pac_t<-PAC_filter(pac_m, anno_target = list("Biotypes_mis0", c("tRNA", "Mt_tRNA")))

ref<-"C:/Users/sigsk47/Documents/PhD/R/Genomes/Drosophila_melanogaster/Drosophila_melanogaster/tRNA/tRNA/tRNA.fa"

map_o<-PAC_mapper(pac_t, ref=ref, N_up="NNN", N_down = "NNN", mapper="reanno", mismatches=0, threads=2, report_string=TRUE)

```

reference have Bowtie indexes

title: Vignette
body:
row 1381 "# Only miRNA (Oops, heavy T-bias on 1st nt; are they piRNA?)" 
That should be miRNA and not piRNA, right?

title: PAC_sizedist - include a user defined limit for ggplot2's scale_y_continuous
body: In order to easily detect between sample differences.

pac_master <- make_PAC(pheno=pheno, anno=NULL, counts=count_list$counts)
names(pac_master)
[1] "Pheno"  "Anno"   "Counts"

lapply(pac_master, head)

  no method for coercing this S4 class to a vector

title: Vignette not clear
body:
Hi,

https://github.com/Danis102/seqpac/blob/master/vignettes/seqpac_-_A_guide_to_sRNA_analysis_using_sequence-based_counts.md#44-the-reannotation-workflow

The vignette before "The reannotation workflow" is clear, whereas not after that. For example, the alignment part is missing.

title: Suggestions
body:
Thanks for the great tool. For a greater portability and accessibility of the tool, I have some suggestions.

Please add:

1. Dockerfile and DockerHub image
2. Nextflow support -> integration into nf-core/smrnaseq pipeline
3. A wrapper script to run the full pipeline with default parameters
4. License information

Thank you.

title: long indices .ebwtl
body: Hi, great tool - Any suggestions how to get it to work with a large reference database though (Bowtie index .ebwtl) - normally you'd add --large-index to the command line.

title: PAC_deseq error when using  pheno_target
body:
Hello,

I obtain the following error using pheno_target even when using the sample data:

`> PAC_deseq(pac,model= ~stage + batch, pheno_target=list("batch"), threads=2)'`

`using pre-existing size factors
estimating dispersions
gene-wise dispersion estimates: 2 workers
Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)) : 
  error in evaluating the argument 'args' in selecting a method for function 'do.call': $ operator is invalid for atomic vectors`
How can I work around this?

Thank you.

title: Error in basename(fls) : object 'fls' not found
body:
Hello,
First of all, thank you for the library.
While creating the count table at the beginning of the tool, I get the error "Error in basename(fls): object 'fls' not found".
The pipeline I use is "devtools::install_github("Danis102/seqpac", dependencies=TRUE)
library(seqpac)

#FASTQ FILES
fastq <- list.files(path = "/archive/yildize/alotaibi_lab/smrnaseq/Elf5_KD/unzipdata", pattern = "fastq", all.files = FALSE,
                     full.names = TRUE)

#PAC OBJECT
count_list <- make_counts(input=fastq, trimming="NULL", threads=4,
                           parse="default_neb")
". I'm new to these issues, so I'm sorry for this simple question. Thank you in advance for your help.

title: No Hit and undefined columns
body:
Hello,
I'm having some problems with the analysis;
1. When I start the analysis with my trimmed samples, it does not detect any hits with the tRNA and miRNA I indexed in the analysis.
2. How can I index multiple tRNA fasta files as a single reference?
3. How can I make this classification for miRNA in the "Hierarchical classification with simplify_reanno" step?
4. In the "Simple stacked bars and pie charts" section, in the PAC_stackbar(pac, anno_target=list("Biotypes_mis0")) code, there is "Error in `[.data.frame`(PAC$Anno, , anno_target[[1]]) :
   I can't get past the "undefined columns selected" error.

I'm adding my codes and reference data to help you. Thank you in advance for your help.
The reference data I used is from https://ncrnainfo-my.sharepoint.com/personal/sports_ncrna_info/_layouts/15/guestaccess.aspx?docid=0833653a140eb47f098267d7a23d3b63c&authkey=Ab8aoYC8paqFI2yRabIo7Ok
[seqpac.txt](https://github.com/Danis102/seqpac/files/14179478/seqpac.txt)
[sample.txt](https://github.com/Danis102/seqpac/files/14179504/sample.txt)
